bibl.title: John McKinnon vs. The United States. Final Mittimus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States 9th Judicial Circuit

div1.ab:
United States of America, northern District of Wash.
SS.
div1.p: The President of the United State sof America, To the Marshal of the northern District of Washington and To the Keeper of the Jail of Spokane County in the State of Wash. Greeting:

Whereas, John McKinnon has been arrested upon the oath of E. C. Simmons special agent for the Government of the Province of B. C. for having, on or about the 18th day of August 1895, in said District Province of B.C. in violation of Section the laws of said Province of B.C. of the Revised Statutes of the United States, unlawfully Commited the crime of Larceny by this and this unlawfully wilgully and feloniously stealing taking and carrying away four neat cattle of the value of Fifty Dollars the goods and chattels of and Cornelius O'Keefe contrary to the Laws of the said Province of British Colubmia, Said affidavit further prays that said John McKinnon be apprehended and committed and that he be extradicted to said Province of British Columbia for trial as provided by law ofthe existing United States and Great Britian for the extradition of person charged with crime.

And after an examination being this day had by me, it appearing to me that said offense had been committed, and it appearing to me that probably cause being shown to believesaid John McKinnon committed said offense as charged, I have directed that said John McKinnon be, commited to the jail of Spokane County Wash. to await the warrant of extradition as forsaid by law.hold to bail in the sum of $ to appear at the first day of the next term of the Court of the United States for the District of at and he having failed to give the required bail:

Now these are therefore, in the name and by the authority aforesaid, to command you, the said Marshal, to commit the said John McKinnonto the custody of the Keeper of said Jail of Spokane County and to leave with said Jailer a certified copy of this writ, and to command you, the keeper of said Jail of said County, to receive the said John McKinnon prisoner of the United States of America, into your custody, in said Jail, and him there safely to keep until he be discharged by due course of law.
In Witness Whereof, I have hereto set my hand and seal at my office in said District, this 23rd day of Dec., A. D . 1896.
div1.ab: Commissioner of the Circuit Court of the United States for the n District of Wash.
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA vs. John McKinnon.
CERTIFICATE (TO BE SIGNED ON COPIES ONLY)
div1.p: I certify the within to be a true copy of the original writ.
div1.ab: U. S. Marhsal, Dist of By Deputy.
THE ROBERT CLARKE COMPANY, Law Publishers, Booksellers, Stationers, Printers, Cincinnati.
Return. (TO BE MADE ON THE ORIGINAL WRIT ONLY)
div1.p: Received this MITTIMUS with the within named Prisoner, on the 23rd day of December A.D. 1896, and on the same day I committed the said Prisoner to the custody of the within named Jail Keeper, with whom I left at the same time a certified copy of this Mittimus.
div1.ab: Dated Dec 23 1896 James C Drake United States Marshal
